name: Final Exam
description: Jump into the frenzied action and the whacky humor of a pure 2.5D side-scroller! While they were going to their old high school for what was supposed to be the party of their life, four long-time friends end up in a ghost town full of monstrous creatures.

reviews.review_text: Fun game. Designed for up to 4 players. Solo play is possible, but slower paced I felt, as I went through the game solo. Game was a bit short, and you end up revisiting some levels. Character animations are good, and the level system is okay. Leaderboards might have its fair share of cheaters, but maybe a purge of sorts could be implemented.  exploration thoughout the game is okay. i have yet to find all of the collectables to get the best weapons, and was able to join 2 games that were in progress online. Not for players expecting a wide range of enemies or deep story - it's all about collecting and killing for leaderboard supremacy.   a very cool pick up game that supports the XBOX controller that shouldn't be missed.

I'm not sure why people are giving this a negative review. This game is an awesome coop game but I wouldn't recommend it for single player. Honestly, the story line is a little odd and not very interesting, but this is one of the few local coop games that actually have some pretty fun gameplay with a controller. Totally recommend this if you're a couch PC gamer that likes to have a few friends over for fun lol.

While the game is very fun as far as beat 'em ups go, I bought it mainly for the couch co-op.  Couch co-op is the main issue with me: you can play couch local co-op with ONLY ONE person more.  Local co-op: 2 people, Online co-op: 4 people.  While this is mainly because of the missions and screen-space, I believe this should have been stressed more. I personally wouldn't have bought it if I knew only two people could play it on one screen.  If you play single/2 player co-op or online and like beat 'em ups - this game is for you and I'd recommend it - it has some sick combos. But if you were looking, like me, for 3-4 player co-op games on the same screen - keep looking, mates.

Great game! Really good fighting system, good responsive movement and combos and many ways to kill your enemies. Skills, weapons and hidden items along the levels. Nice graphics and sound. It get's a bit difficult by moments, as there's a high rate of respawn, even in easy, but not to get frustrating. Lots of fun, and you can play it co-op in a single PC Definitely recommend it!

Well, I got this game in the humblebundle for a buck to have an evening of coop with my buddy and it was servicable for that, but little more. The game consists of basically 3 maps, on which you play the 8 missions. It has 4 types of enemies and one bosstype. Balancing is inexistent. Highly repedetive, but short. Netcode is solid though. We searched for every item and extra, which takes some time, if you don't you can breeze through the game in under two hours.
